title: U.S. Space Command takes over responsibility for protecting homeland from missile strikes
summary: U.S. Space Command has officially been assigned responsibilities for protecting the United States from missile attacks, a job previously held by U.S. Strategic Command.

title: Using data from Spitzer and TESS, scientists discover exoplanet littered with volcanoes
summary: Using data collected by NASA’s retired Spitzer Space Telescope and NASA’s Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS), a team of scientists has discovered an exoplanet that could potentially be covered with volcanoes. The exoplanet is Earth-sized, and the team’s results suggest that the gravitational pull of a neighboring exoplanet could be causing an increase in volcanic activity on the exoplanet.

title: SpaceX caps off busy May with 8th Falcon 9 launch
summary: SpaceX successfully launched another Starlink mission at 11:02 PM PT (06:02 UTC), this time sending 52 V1.5 Starlink satellites to orbit from...

title: NASA to Discuss Conclusions of Psyche Mission Independent Review Board
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 4 p.m. EDT on Monday, June 5, to discuss the follow-up report by the Psyche mission independent review board. The new assessment reviews corrective actions taken following the November 2022 report.

title: ESA Awards Contracts to Define Future European Launch Systems
summary: The European Space Agency awarded four contracts to industrial partners on 29 May to study solutions for future European expendable and reusable launch systems covering micro/mini, medium, heavy, and human-rated applications.

title: Cutting-Edge Reconnaissance Satellites: Revolutionizing National Security from Space
summary: Ever since humanity gained access to space, observation satellites, also known as “reconnaissance satellites,” have become a highly sought-after strategic capability for many nations. These satellites employ optical sensors for […]

title: Axiom-2 Crew returns to Earth after 10 days in space
summary: Following an 8-day stay aboard the International Space Station, the Axiom-2 crew made a fiery plunge back through Earth’s atmosphere to a...

title: North Korea’s spy satellite launch fails with second-stage malfunction
summary: A North Korean rocket failed shortly after liftoff May 31, plunging into the ocean with its spy satellite payload.

title: Satellite operators Viasat and Inmarsat complete merger deal
summary: Viasat said May 31 it closed the acquisition of Inmarsat it announced a year and a half ago after clearing all regulatory hurdles to consolidate the satellite operators.

title: Second Axiom Space private astronaut mission concludes with splashdown
summary: A SpaceX Crew Dragon spacecraft splashed down in the Gulf of Mexico late May 30, concluding Axiom Space’s second private astronaut mission to the International Space Station.
